author: sussman
msg: Fix 'make check' in wake of the new $EDITOR commit feature.
* actions.py (run_and_verify_commit):  pass a -m flag to all commits;
otherwise the test suite tries to invoke $EDITOR.  This fixes most of
our python tests.
Tests that are running 'ci' directly, instead of using above API:
* svn-test.sh, svn-test2.sh:  same change as above.
* update_tests.py (update_ignores_added):  same change.
* prop_tests.py (remove_props): same change.
* diff_tests.py (change_diff_commit_diff): same change.
(diff_pure_repository_update_a_file): same change.
* commit_tests.py (commit_in_dir_scheduled_for_addition): same
change.  But on second look, this test needs fixing... "I do not
think it does what you think it does."  Will fix in separate commit.

author: daniel
msg: Fixes issue #604
This commit lets you edit the commit message in your favourite editor.
* ./subversion/clients/cmdline/cl.h
(svn_cl__generate_status_codes) added
* /subversion/clients/cmdline/status.c
(generate_status_codes) renamed to:
(svn_cl__generate_status_codes) new name for the function that displays a
letter combination to visualize a directory entry's status. Used by the
commit-cmd.c too now.
* ./subversion/clients/cmdline/commit-cmd.c
(print_short_format) New. Go through a hash and write a status line for
each entry to a given file.
(print_status) New. Walk through the targets to gather status.
(write_status_to_file) New. Gather a complete status output for inclusion as
a commit message comment.
(message_from_editor) New. Invoke an editor and get the comment.
(store_message) New. Store a given message in a "temporary" file.
(svn_cl__commit) If no message was given, get one from message_from_editor()
and handle if no message was returned then as well. If a message was given
with an editor and the commit fails, save the commit message before returning
the error.
Things left to do related to this functionality:
- add configure check for vi and use that as default editor if no other can
be found
- add command line option to set editor
- add config file entry for editor
- make sure error codes is returned properly from all functions

author: daniel
msg: svn_wc_create_tmp_file() got an additional boolean argument to say if the
temporary file should be deleted on close. This functionality is wanted for
temporary files with a post-close life.
* ./subversion/include/svn_wc.h
(svn_wc_create_tmp_file): fixed proto
* ./subversion/libsvn_client/ra.c
(open_admin_tmp_file): added a TRUE argument to the svn_wc_create_tmp_file()
call
* ./subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_files.c
(svn_wc_create_tmp_file): get the new argument and pass that to the
svn_io_open_unique_file function invoke properly
[if you see this, this is the first live commit edited with the upcoming
$EDITOR fix]

author: dws
msg: * INSTALL: Changes requested by kfogel.  The original formatting was returned
and the sections on building the source and binary RPMS have been taken out
of this file and should be read from the packages/rpm/README file.  A note
in the RPM BOOTSTRAPPING section references the packages/rpm/README file.
* packages/rpm/README: Reformatted to look nicer and updated the information.

author: gstein
msg: Example (Python) program to fetch files from a Subversion repository.
